xierpa3.toolbox.database.s3 package¶

Submodules¶

xierpa3.toolbox.database.s3.s3connector module¶

class xierpa3.toolbox.database.s3.s3connector.S3Connector(domain, accesskeyid, secretaccesskey)¶

<doc>Xierpa wrapper for Amazon S3 connection and bucket using the boto library. Enables us to send and retrieve files from the data storage. Multiple instances are possible for data retrieval from different buckets.</doc>

BUCKET = None¶
CONNECTION = None¶
deleteKey(key)¶

<doc> Deletes the key that is passed. </doc>

deleteKeyFromBucket(keyname)¶
getAllBuckets()¶
getAllKeys(headers=None, prefix='', delimiter='', maxkeys=10000)¶

<doc> A lower-level method for listing contents of a bucket. This closely models the actual S3 API and requires you to manually handle the paging of results. For a higher-level method that handles the details of paging for you, you can use the list method. Parameters:

max_keys (int) – The maximum number of keys to retrieve. prefix (string) – The prefix of the keys you want to retrieve. marker (string) – The “marker” of where you are in the result set. delimiter (string) – If this optional, Unicode string parameter is included with your request, then keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter will be rolled up into a single result element in the CommonPrefixes collection. These rolled-up keys are not returned elsewhere in the response.

Return type: ResultSet Returns: The result from S3 listing the keys requested </doc>

getBucket(name=None, create=True)¶

<doc> Get an AWS bucket with exception handling. Creates the bucket if it doesn’t already exist. </doc>

getFile(key, fp)¶

<doc> Puts a file in the fp file pointer, which is a temporary file object:

<code>
fp = open(<tmp-path>, ‘w’) </code>

</doc>

Throws an exception if key is none.

<doc> </doc>

getKey(key)¶

<doc> We describe keys as paths within buckets. Returns None if the key doesn’t exist. </doc>

<doc> Auxiliary definition showing all available buckets. </doc>

makeFilePointer(key, tmppath)¶

<doc> Gets a file from S3 using the key and store it on a temporary location for further processing. </doc>

makeFilePointerByPath(s3path, tmppath)¶

<doc> Gets a file from S3 using the path and store it on a temporary location for further processing. </doc>

readFileFromS3(keyname, path)¶

The <code>readFileFromS3</code> method reads the content of <attr>keyname</attr> from S3 and writes it the file with <attr>path</attr>. Answer the a boolean flag to indicate of the operation succeeded.

readString(keyname)¶
sendFile(key, file)¶
writeFileToS3(keyname, path, mimetype=None, acl='public-read')¶

<doc> Writes file contents from local file to S3 with key as name. </doc>

writeString(keyname, string, mimetype=None)¶

<doc> Writes text to the file with key as name. </doc>
